subject: What's delta?
msgSnippet: Hi all, The obvious answer: That triangle-shaped Greek letter commonly used to represent change (sometimes variance) in math-speak. The less confusing (for me)
messageBody:
Hi all,
 
    The obvious answer: That triangle-shaped Greek letter commonly used to represent change (sometimes variance) in math-speak.
   
    The less confusing (for me) answer: An argument to assertEquals(), namely
        assertEquals(double expected, double actual, double delta)
 
    I rtfm and rtfc it didn't explain this to my satisfaction.  It appears that delta is being used as a measure of precision.  i.e.) assertEquals(.05, .75, 6) should pass.  I have some guesses at the reason for using such a measure, but I was hoping someone out there could elinghten me as to the best reasons for using it, so that I might choose the best delta values possible.
 
    - Matt
